Text:
Wow...the wholesale district...! There are so many
merchants!

The motto here is, "We treat you like family." There
are merchants discussing business all over the place.

From over there, I can smell something really
sweet... The smell of cakes.

Sherry, you are gawking a lot, like a country
bumpkin.
Ohh... Sorry. I will conduct myself properly.

Yes. Now let's go to a toy wholesaler to order
presents.

That went without a hitch. Takes just one mention of
Alexia's name...

That shop assistant was happy to be a purveyor to the
royal family.
Well, I am a Princess of Midgar Kingdom.

I don't particularly go around dropping names about
who sells me things, but their goods weren't half bad.

(But I didn't like that shop assistant. Their eyes
lit up as soon as they heard my name.)
Next we should order cakes. Is that okay, Sherry?
Ah, yes!

I made a list of cake shops which have my personal
mark of approval!

(I thought you were going to buy something for Pooch,
but maybe you're thinking of a cake rather than
something else.)
...We need a lot, like this many. Can you do it?

Yes, we can. The weather is cold here, so we can make
ice cream cakes.

They keep for a long time, so we have plenty of
stock. Delivery tonight, yes? We will manage it
somehow.
Wow, that's great!

Here is the money and a list of merchants who will
come collect the cakes.

...Okay, I understand. Thank you for ordering with
us.

Um, I heard that customers can experience cake making
 here...?

(Finally...! Now I get it. She intends to make a
Christmas cake here for Pooch.)
Oh yes, we have that kind of service for tourists.
Rose's words float into Alexia's mind.

I would like you to be by her side and support her.
You know, stop her from going around in circles.

(Sherry, I'm sorry. I really do want to support you,
but...)
Sherry, I don't think we have time for this.

The shop will likely need to make arrangements to
cart everything off tonight.

They're prepared for that, but it's unlikely they
can do much for us during such a busy time.
Y-You're right...
Sherry seems taken aback.
I am truly sorry. It is just as you say.

No, that won't be an issue. At any rate, thank you
for handling the delivery.

Yes, please leave the cakes to us. Thank you for your
order!

(Ah, I feel terrible... Sherry is doing her best,
but I ruined her plans.)

Although the shop assistant is smiling cheerfully,
Alexia feels storm clouds in her heart.

Oh...it's already time to meet the merchant who is
transporting our fir tree.
Um, Alexia! Thank you for earlier!
Why are you thanking me?

Because...you were right, Alexia. Something was up
with me.

I was just thinking of myself. I wasn't thinking
about others' time or availability...

Alexia, you set me right. You're a true leader above
all others. You're amazing!

(You're not being unpleasant or sarcastic. You're
really being sincere.)
...I want to thank you too. I feel better now.
Huh, why are you thanking me, Alexia?
Why? I just thought I should.
Hehe, you can be strange sometimes, Alexia...
Yeah, I'm strange... Haha.

(My chest still feels tight, but I think that the
storm clouds are dispersing.)

By the way, the merchant is late. He should have met
us here before the sun set.

That's true, if he was going to be late he should
have let us know in advance...

A long shadow falls on the meeting place, rocking
side to side on unsteady footsteps.
E-Excuse me... My goods... Monsters...
